question: A reliable conductor used to ensure the required conductivity between metal parts which are to be electrically connected is called which of the following:
The current measured in amperes which a conductor can carry continuously under standard conditions without exceeding the conductor's maximum temperature rating is called:
Limiting the total quantity of circuits in any given enclosure does which of the following:

options.a: Minimizes the effects of a short circuit in one circuit
options.c: Provides easy access to qualified workers
options.d: Provides a standard for the Authority Having Jurisdiction

correct_answer_text: Minimizes the effects of a short circuit in one circuit

question: Items in the Code that identify actions that are specifically required or prohibited are considered which of the following:
Two or more ungrounded conductors with equal voltage running between them and a grounded conductor is considered which of the following:
A device that de-energizes a circuit or a portion of a circuit within an established time frame when a current to ground exceeds the values determined for a Class A device is which of the following:
A device that protects a motor against overheating and is an integral part of that motor is considered which of the following:
An assembly of two or more single-pole fuses is which of the following:
A continuous load is one in which one of the following types of current is expected to run non-stop for three hours or more:

A branch circuit where two or more ungrounded conductors, with a potential difference between them, and a grounded conductor with equal potential difference between it and each ungrounded conductor is referred to as which of the following:
The purpose of the Philippine Electrical Code is to provide which of the following:

options.a: A standard by which professionals may design installations

question: Circuit voltage is best defined as which of the following:

options.b: Maximum potential difference between two conductors
options.c: Effective difference of potential between two conductors
options.d: Total amperes produced between two conductors

correct_answer_text: Effective difference of potential between two conductors

question: The connection device installed at an outlet to allow for two or more contact devices at the same yoke is which of the following:
A large single panel assembly of panels containing mounted switches, overcurrent and protection devices and buses is considered which of the following:
A switching device utilized to isolate a circuit or equipment from an established power source is determined to be which of the following:
A compartment to which one or more air ducts are connected to form part of an air distribution system is called which of the following:
Which of the following installations are covered by the Electrical Code:

options.a: Power wiring for a large industrial machine
options.b: Computer wiring in an office building
options.c: Telephone cable in a flexible duct

question: Chose the answer below that is not an approved means of mounting electrical equipment to a masonry wall:

options.a: Using screws that are driven into wooden plugs in the wall
options.b: Using bolts that are supported by metal plates on the back side
options.c: Using molly bolts through holes drilled completely through the wall
options.d: Using lag bolts screwed into lead masonry anchors

correct_answer_text: Using screws that are driven into wooden plugs in the wall

question: The clear work space on one side of equipment with exposed live parts, which operates at 600 volts nominal or less to ground, and which will require examination, adjustment or maintenance shall be at least which of the following:

options.d: 2 times the width of the panel

question: The floor of a vault for electrical equipment with either a vacant space or additional floors below it shall have a minimum fire resistance of which of the following:
Circuits with 100 amperes or less, or with 2.0 sq mm to 50 sq mm conductors, can only be used for conductors rated at which of the following:
Voltage to ground of 0-150, with exposed live parts on one side of the work space and no live or grounded parts on the other side, must have a minimum clear distance of which of the following:
The work space for equipment must allow opening of any equipment doors or hinged panels.
The minimum clear headroom for work space around service equipment, switchboards, panelboards, or motor control centers must be which of the following:
High-voltage conductor tunnel installations require metal conduit or metal raceways and which of the following:
Unused raceway or cable openings in boxes and conduits must be closed so that the protection provided is which of the following:

options.a: At least equal to the protection provided by the wall of the box or conduit
options.b: Equal to the depth of the wall framing
options.c: Greater than the protection provided by the box or conduit alone
options.d: Adequate to act as a fire stop

correct_answer_text: At least equal to the protection provided by the wall of the box or conduit

question: The fire rating for walls, floors and doors containing equipment over 600 volts nominal shall be a minimum of which of the following:
Often, equipment and terminations are labeled with which of the following:
Ventilation system electrical controls shall be installed in manner in which the airflow can be managed in which of the following ways:
In order to be electrically secure prior to soldering, splices must be which of the following:
Unless otherwise specified, live parts for electrical equipment operating at ____ volts or more shall be guarded.
Voltage to ground of 150-600 with exposed live parts on both sides of the working space must have a clear distance not less than which of the following:
Concrete and brick walls are considered which of the following:
If a conductor material is not specified in a particular Article or Section, the material shall be assumed to be which of the following:
A high-leg conductor in a three-phase, 4-wire delta secondary shall be which of the following colors:
Conductor sizes are listed in which of the following:

A single-family dwelling has three bathrooms each with the following: a lighting fixture, a fan, and one receptacle outlet. In one of the bathrooms, the lighting fixture, fan, and receptacle outlet are installed on a dedicated 20 ampere circuit. For this dwelling, the minimum number of 20 ampere circuits required to serve the bathrooms is which of the following:

One building is supplied power from another building on a non-industrial property with a single owner. The underground feeder is protected by a 100 ampere circuit breaker in the first building. Qualified persons are not always available to service the installation; therefore, the disconnecting means for the second building must be which of the following:

options.a: Located inside the second building, and is not required to be located near the point where the conductors enter the building
options.b: At the closest practical point where the conductors enter the bullding, and may be located elther Inside or outside of the building
options.c: The circuit breaker in the first building
options.d: Located on the outside of the building, near the point where the conductors enter the building

correct_answer_text: At the closest practical point where the conductors enter the bullding, and may be located elther Inside or outside of the building

question: In a single-phase, 3-wire electrical system, the middle conductor must be which of the following:

In a 3-wire, single phase electrical system, the nominal voltage must be 120 volts between the ungrounded conductor and the neutral, and the volts between the two ungrounded conductors must be which of the following:
In a single-phase, 3-wire electrical system, the hot conductors are referred to as which of the following:
The current flowing through the neutral of a 120/240 volt 3-wire, single-phase electrical system is calculated as which of the following?

options.a: The difference between the current of the two ungrounded conductors
options.b: The sum of the current flowing on the two ungrounded conductors
options.c: The current of the first ungrounded conductor divided by the current of the second ungrounded conductor

correct_answer_text: The difference between the current of the two ungrounded conductors

question: The exposed non-current carrying metal parts of a hand-held cord-and-plug drill must be grounded in which of the following scenarios:

options.a: The power source is greater than 150 volts to ground
options.b: The drill is for residential use
options.c: The drill is being used in a hazardous location

question: If a rod electrode is required for grounding purposes and a layer of rock restricts the rod from being driven into the ground, which of the following alternate methods of installation shall be used:

options.a: Connect to the nearest steel section of the building
options.b: Connect to the metal water main
options.c: Bury the rod in a trench which is a minimum of 1500 mm deep
options.d: Bury the rod in steel conduit with a minimum of 150 mm of cover

correct_answer_text: Bury the rod in a trench which is a minimum of 1500 mm deep

question: Terminals connected to a grounded conductor shall be identified in which of the following ways:

options.a: Identification shall be substantially white in color
options.b: Connection must use a terminal screw that is not readily removable and is green in color
options.c: Identification must include an engraved metal tag

correct_answer_text: Identification shall be substantially white in color

question: The receptacle example listed below which may be connected to a small appliance branch circuit is which of the following:

options.a: Garage celling receptacle for an automatic garage door opener
options.b: Any receptacle which is within 3600 mm of the kitchen
options.c: An electric clock plugged in at the dining room

correct_answer_text: An electric clock plugged in at the dining room

question: The service disconnection means in a building shall not have more than how many switches or circuit breakers:
The total number of underground conductors for an outside lighting circuit on a single common neutral conductor is which of the following:

options.d: Underground conductors specified in this example are prohibited

question: When protected solely by enamel, which of the following shall not be Installed in outdoor or wet locations:
The total number of quarter bends allowed in a single run of rigid nonmetallic conduit shall not exceed which of the following:
A standard rating for an overcurrent device is which of the following:
A main bonding jumper is which of the following:

options.a: The connection between the grounding conductor and an equipment grounding conductor at a separately derived system
options.b: The connection between a grounding conductor and equipment operating at 600 volts nominal or less
options.c: The connection between the main electrical service and a grounding conductor
options.d: The connection between the grounded circult conductor and the equipment grounding conductor at the service

correct_answer_text: The connection between the grounded circult conductor and the equipment grounding conductor at the service

question: The electrical continuity at service equipment and service conductors must be ensured by using which of the following installation techniques:

options.a: Threaded couplings or threaded bosses on enclosures are made wrenchtight
options.b: Bushings with bonding jumpers are used

question: Lightning protection system ground terminals must be bonded to which of the following:

options.b: The building or structure grounding electrode systems
options.c: To a common grounding electrode conductor

correct_answer_text: The building or structure grounding electrode systems

question: Enclosures around electrical equipment enclosures shall be considered accessible if they are controlled by which of the following:

options.c: Keypad locks to which a qualified person has the code in order to unlock the enclosure

question: A system bonding jumper is which of the following:

options.a: The connection between the grounded circuit conductor and the equipment grounding conductor at a separately derived system
options.b: A wiring system that connects two or more separately derived systems
options.c: The connection between the grounded circuit conductor and the equipment grounding conductor at the service
options.d: A wiring system that connects a grounded circuit conductor to equipment

correct_answer_text: The connection between the grounded circuit conductor and the equipment grounding conductor at a separately derived system

question: Type AC cables are allowed for which of the following uses:
Size 2.0 sq mm copper conductor, type THHN cable is permitted in which of the following applications:
For a two-family dwelling unit located at grade level, how many outlets are required, assuming installation is no more than 2,000 mm above grade level:

options.a: One outlet at each exterior door
options.b: One outlet at the front of the dwelling unit
options.d: One outlet at the front and one at the back of the unit

correct_answer_text: One outlet at each exterior door

question: A branch circuit that consists of at least two ungrounded conductors with a potential difference between them and an identified grounded conductor which has equal potential between it and each of the ungrounded conductors is considered which of the following:
A single open conductor which does not serve as a service entrance cable must be installed at which of the following depths:

options.a: Not less than 3,100 mm from grade level
options.b: A minimum of 2,000 mm from grade level
options.c: Not more than 3,100 mm from grade level
options.d: Not less than 2,000 mm from grade level unless encased in concrete

correct_answer_text: Not less than 3,100 mm from grade level

question: If open conductors are exposed to physical damage, they must be installed in which of the following:
Concealed knob-and-tube wiring is not permitted in which of the following applications:
Rigid metal conduit shall be permitted in which of the following installations:
An insulated conductor assembly with fittings and conductor terminations that is completely enclosed in a ventilated protective metal housing is called which of the following:
A cablebus shall not be used for which of the following:
Unless identified otherwise, a busway shall not be installed in which of the following locations:
Branches from busways shall be permitted to use which of the following wiring methods:

options.a: Type MC and Type AC cable
options.b: Type RMC and Type FMC conduits
options.c: Rigid nonmetallic conduit and electrical nonmetallic tubing

question: Which of the following means shall be installed to remove condensed moisture for low points in a busway run:

options.d: Neither-busway runs are not permitted to have low points

question: If a neutral bus is required, it shall be sized to carry all neutral load current and shall meet which of the following stipulations:

options.a: Be of adequate size to carry harmonic currents
options.b: Have an adequate momentary rating consistent with any system requirements
options.c: Have a short-circuit rating consistent with system requirements

correct_answer_text: Have an adequate momentary rating consistent with any system requirements

question: A sheet metal auxillary gutter may be used for which of the following applications:

options.a: To supplement wiring spaces at switchboards

correct_answer_text: To supplement wiring spaces at switchboards

question: Nonmetallic auxiliary gutters installed outdoors shall be marked indicating which of the following:

options.b: Sultable for use in wet locations

correct_answer_text: Sultable for use in wet locations

question: Intermediate metal conduit shall be permitted in which of the following installations:
IMC shall be permitted for use as which of the following:

options.b: An unsupported vertical riser from fixed equipment

correct_answer_text: An unsupported vertical riser from fixed equipment

question: Underground feeder cable shall be prohibited for which of the following installations:
Underground feeder cable shall be permitted for which of the following applications;
A nonmetallic extension shall consist of which of the following installation requirements:

options.a: A continuous, unbroken length of assembly must be used
options.b: The assembly shall not contain splices
options.c: The extension assembly can not have exposed conductors between fittings

correct_answer_text: A continuous, unbroken length of assembly must be used

question: Unless otherwise prohibited, type NMC cable is permitted for which of the following applications:

options.c: In molst, damp or corrosive locations

question: Type NMS cable is permitted for which of the following applications:

options.a: Corrosive locations exposed to fumes or vapors
options.c: Exposed work in normally dry locations

question: Type MI cable shall not be used for which of the following applications:

options.a: Where embedded in plaster or concrete

correct_answer_text: Where embedded in plaster or concrete

question: Type FCC cabling shall be approved for which of the following uses:

options.b: General purpose branch circuits that do not exceed 30 amperes
options.c: Individual branch circuits that do not exceed 20 amperes

correct_answer_text: General purpose branch circuits that do not exceed 30 amperes

question: Which of the following statements is true for FCC cable systems:

options.a: Unused cable runs and associated cable connectors may be left in place and energized.
options.b: New cable connectors must be used to make alterations at new connection points.

correct_answer_text: New cable connectors must be used to make alterations at new connection points.

question: FC cable assemblies are permitted to be used in which of the following applications:

options.a: As branch circuits to supply tap devices for small appliances not to exceed 30 amps

question: Armored cable is permitted for use in which of the following installations:

options.b: Embedded in plaster finish on brick in dry locations

question: Nonmetallic boxes shall only be used for which of the following installations:
Conductors run in parallel in each phase, polarity, neutral, or grounded circult conductor must comply with which of the following:

options.a: Be terminated in the same manner and have the same insulation type
options.b: Have the same size circular mil area
options.c: Be of the same length and conductor material

correct_answer_text: Be terminated in the same manner and have the same insulation type

question: In a situation where more than one calculated ampacity could apply to a circuit length, which of the following values shall be used:

options.c: An average of the combined ampacities

question: Raceways that are exposed to a variety of temperatures shall be which of the following:
An assembly of units and associated fittings that form a rigid structural system used to support cables and raceways is considered which of the following:
A pliable raceway has which of the following characteristics:

options.a: It requires a manual or automatic bender to ensure safe bends
options.b: It can be bent by hand without requiring any other assistance

correct_answer_text: It can be bent by hand without requiring any other assistance

question: If a nonmetallic surface raceway is used, the installation must meet which of the following conditions:

options.a: The building must be used for offices
options.b: The building cannot exceed four floors

correct_answer_text: The building cannot exceed four floors

question: If there are 7 current-carrying conductors in a raceway, then the individual ampacity of each conductor must be reduced by which of the following:

options.a: 70% because of the number of conductors

question: The following wiring method is approved to be installed inside a duct used for vapor removal and ventilation of commercial type equipment:
When conductors of different systems are installed in a common raceway or cable the derating factors used shall be which of the following:

options.a: Applled only to the number of power and lighting conductors
options.b: Be Increased by one over the total derating factor
options.c: Be at least 50% of the highest rated cable

correct_answer_text: Be Increased by one over the total derating factor

question: Screws used to mount knobs shall be long enough to penetrate the wood in accordance with which of the following:

options.a: At a depth which is twice the height of the knob
options.b: At thickness at least twice the thickness of the screw
options.c: At a depth at least one-half the height of the knob

correct_answer_text: At a depth which is twice the height of the knob

question: When calculating the number of conductors in a box, a conductor running through the box shall be counted as which of the following:
When installed in raceways, conductors which are #8 AWG or larger shall meet which of the following requirements:
When a conductor is installed in conduit exposed to direct sunlight and in close proximity to a rooftop, under certain circumstances it can experience which of the following:

options.a: A temperature rise of 30 degrees F above the amblent temperature on which the conductor ampacity is based
options.b: 10 degrees C above the conductor temperature rating
options.c: A swelling in the conductor insulation

correct_answer_text: A temperature rise of 30 degrees F above the amblent temperature on which the conductor ampacity is based

question: For fixed electric space heating equipment consisting of resistance elements with a motor, the branch circuit conductor ampacity and the overcurrent rating of the protective device that supplies the equipment shall not be less than which of the following:

options.a: 100% of the total heating equipment load
options.c: 125% of the total load of the motor and the heaters
options.d: The combined ampacity of all of the equipment

correct_answer_text: 125% of the total load of the motor and the heaters

question: The disconnection means for fixed appliances within a ten-unit apartment building must be in which of the following locations:

options.b: In the main mechanical room of the building
options.c: In an accessible common location within the building
options.d: Within each individual unit or on the same floor in the building

correct_answer_text: Within each individual unit or on the same floor in the building

question: The ampacity of multiconductor cables installed in a cable tray shall be derated based on which of the following:

options.b: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable
options.c: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable tray

correct_answer_text: The total number of current carrying conductors in the cable tray

question: Which of the following entrances does not require a switched outlet

options.d: All of these require a switched outlet
